member.name: Effect.GetAuxData
member.summary: The Effect.GetAuxData gets a pointer to a set of lookup tables created by a previous call to the method.
member.returns: This method returns a pointer to a set of lookup tables created by a previous call to . If no lookup tables are available, the return value is NULL.

member.name: Effect.GetAuxDataSize
member.summary: The Effect.GetAuxDataSize method gets the size, in bytes, of the auxiliary data created by a previous call to the method.
member.returns: This method returns the size, in bytes, of the auxiliary data.

member.name: Effect.GetParameterSize
member.summary: The Effect.GetParameterSize method gets the total size, in bytes, of the parameters currently set for this Effect. The Effect.GetParameterSize method is usually called on an object that is an instance of a descendant of the Effect class.
member.param: Pointer to a UINT that receives the total size of the parameters.

returns.para: If the method succeeds, it returns Ok, which is an element of the enumeration.
If the method fails, it returns one of the other elements of the enumeration.

member.name: Effect.UseAuxData
member.summary: The Effect.UseAuxData method sets or clears a flag that specifies whether the method should return a pointer to the auxiliary data that it creates.
member.param: Set to TRUE to specify that should return a pointer to its auxiliary data; FALSE otherwise.
